author: manunlp
content:
Actually I'm not sure if it should be done in status or metadata.
The issue is if we do it status, a the peer could think that the updated cgc in ENR/metadata corresponds to the (old) value in status.
(Prysm requires status twice per epoch.)

author: jimmygchen
content: Thereâ€™s a new proposal to add a lowest_block_epoch field to status message to address that. Just had a breakout and seems like a good solution without introducing too much complexity.

author: jimmygchen
content:
So if a node increases CGC, and advertise it immediately, theyâ€™d update lowest_block_epoch to the current epoch, to indicate they only have the advertise columns from this point. So peers would not Downscore them from not having columns before this epoch. 

If the node chooses to backfill, then it will update this field as they progress with backfill.

content:
Proposal <@&1367819082019377202> :
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4374

**Note 1:** This proposal does not take into account the <@833706406699073536> 's idea about bitmasks to allow beacon nodes to convey different coverage ranges for different sets of columns. Could you tell more about it?
**Note 2:** Issue from <@293154341127454721>: If a malicious peer advertises a given `cgc`, but keeps maintaining its `lowest_slot` equals to `head_slot`, then the malicious peer will never have to actually serve any sidecar, without being penalized.

This is the idea resulting from the breakout session.
